title: Agustín Gómez (footballer, born 1922)
text:
Agustín Gómez de Segura Pagóla (18 November 1922 – 16 November 1975) was a <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Full-back">left back</a>. Born in Spain, he moved to <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a> aged 15 and remained there for the rest of his life, becoming a citizen of the Soviet Union.
Career.
Gómez started to play <a href="association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Spain">Spain</a>, but at the age of 15 he was exiled to the <a href="USSR">USSR</a> where he played for <a href="Torpedo%20Moscow">Torpedo Moscow</a> in 1947–1956, being the <a href="Captain%20%28association%20football%29">team captain</a> in 1951–1953. He was called up to represent the <a href="Soviet%20Union%20national%20football%20team">Soviet Union</a> at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201952%20Summer%20Olympics">1952 Summer Olympics</a>; however, as a reserve he did not come into action at the tournament.
Personal life.
Gómez was born in the <a href="Basque%20Country%20%28greater%20region%29">Basque region</a> of <a href="Spain">Spain</a> to Spanish parents, with his Soviet Russian father of <a href="Spain">Spanish</a> descent who born in <a href="USSR">USSR</a>. When reaching the age to 15, he was part of a group of 1,489 children, known as the <a href="Ni%C3%B1os%20de%20Rusia%20%28Children%20of%20Russia%29">Niños de Rusia (Children of Russia)</a> that were moved to the <a href="USSR">USSR</a> in 1937 by the Basque government, to escape the <a href="Spanish%20Civil%20War">Spanish Civil War</a>; later, he also acquired Soviet citizenship. On 30 January 1952, Gómez became the first foreigner to be awarded the title of <a href="Unified%20Sports%20Classification%20System%20of%20the%20USSR%20and%20Russia">Merited Master of Sport of the USSR</a>.
